title: 107_s2458
content: Establishment of initiatives for predominantly Muslim countries. The Congress finds that negative opinions and images of the United States in predominantly Muslim countries are distorted by misinformation and propaganda, which is prejudicial to US interests and foreign policy. The Congress aims to counter negative opinions and images of the United States in predominantly Muslim countries through programs promoting American society and values. The Secretary of State will establish educational and cultural exchange initiatives with these countries. The Department of State will establish programs for foreign journalists and journalism students in countries with predominantly Muslim populations to improve professionalism in journalism. Additionally, the Secretary of State will develop libraries as part of educational and cultural exchange initiatives. The Secretary of State will implement a program to assist foreign governments in establishing or upgrading public library systems to improve literacy, support education, and provide youth recreation centers. The program aims to advance American values, particularly freedom and democracy, through training in library sciences and exchange opportunities for postsecondary study in the United States. The Secretary will establish a program to promote American values and society through postsecondary study and English language teaching grants for US citizens in middle and secondary schools. Sister city partnerships between the US and other countries will also be expanded. The Secretary will expand sister city partnerships between the US and foreign municipalities to increase global cooperation at the community level. These partnerships will focus on economic development, municipal cooperation, health care initiatives, youth and educational programs, disability advocacy, emergency preparedness, and humanitarian assistance. Additionally, a program will be established for middle and secondary school students from foreign countries to visit the US during school holidays. A program for visits by middle and secondary school students from foreign countries to the United States during school holidays, focusing on cultural and educational activities to familiarize students with American society and values. Coordination with US schools for school-based activities is encouraged. The Secretary aims to increase awards under the Fulbright exchange program for individuals from the US to study, teach, or conduct research in predominantly Muslim countries. The Secretary aims to increase awards for scholars and teachers from the US to study, teach, or conduct research in predominantly Muslim countries, including subjects related to American studies. Additionally, there is a focus on increasing Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowships for candidates from these countries. Programs will be carried out under specific acts governing educational and cultural exchanges. The Secretary will establish a database of American and foreign alumni of international exchange programs to promote networking and communication. Additionally, a report will be made on the inclusion of freedom and democracy advocates in educational and cultural exchange programs. The Secretary of State must submit a report to Congress within 90 days regarding the implementation of exchange programs to countries supporting freedom and democracy. The report will detail the number of grants submitted for bidding, measures taken to ensure inclusion of supporters of freedom and democracy, and an evaluation of the exchange programs. The Secretary of State must report to Congress on the implementation of exchange programs to countries supporting democracy, ensuring grantees are selected with consideration for democracy. The report will evaluate if the programs are fully open to democracy supporters and detail any obstacles and measures being taken to address them. SEC. 4. STATUTORY CONSTRUCTION. This Act does not allow visas or admission to the US for inadmissible aliens. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. $35,000,000 authorized for the Department of State for fiscal years 2003 and 2004. SEC. 6. SECRETARY DEFINED. "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of State.
